Critical value for Nair's equal-precision confidence bands (Monte Carlo)

Source: R/RcppExports.R
WH_e_alpha_MC.Rd

Computes the critical value e for Nair's equal-precision confidence bands¹ using Monte Carlo simulation. Note: to reproduce Table 2 of Nair (1984), use alpha/2.

Usage

WH_e_alpha_MC(
  lower,
  upper,
  alpha,
  n_step = 100000L,
  n_rep = 100000L,
  seed = 24601L
)

Arguments

lower

Lower limit of supremum evaluation.

upper

Upper limit of supremum evaluation.

alpha

Significance level.

n_step

Number of discretization steps for each variance-stabilized Brownian bridge. Default = 1e5.

n_rep

Number of Monte Carlo replicates. Default = 1e5.

seed

Random seed. Default = 24601.

Value

The critical value \(e_\alpha\).

Details

Parallelized using OpenMP if available.

References

  1. Nair, V.N., 1984. Conﬁdence bands for survival functions with censored data: a comparative study. Technometrics, 26, pp. 265–275.
